review.title: “Part-time job for 12 + years”
review.pros: Pros – Unlike some workout facilities the Y is more of a laid back family oriented place to work out as well as hang with your kids or take a class (fitness as well as non-fitness related).I've been able to have a balanced family and part-time work life.In addition to my hourly rate I get a discounted membership paying the difference between a single adult and family membership which amounts to a couple dollars out of each paycheck. The current policy is employees must work a minimum of 20 hours quarterly (every 3 months) to be able to receive the membership discount.Working as many or few hours as my family and other part time job allows has never been a problem. Folks are usually willing to trade or take shifts.
review.cons: Cons – There is a 20-word minimum here and I can't think of any so I'm just going to say there has never been a reason for me to leave my part time position.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work!

review.title: “Great place to work to build community relationships.”
review.pros: Pros – They create a very family oriented.
review.cons: Cons – Too many part-time employees. Creates some issues with commitment.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to increase full-time more committed staff.
